title: Eulerian paths
content: According to Wikipedia ("Eulerian path", 9-Mar-2021, ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eulerian_path ): "In graph theory, an _Eulerian trail_ (or _Eulerian path_) is a trail in a finite graph that visits every edge exactly once (allowing for revisiting vertices). Similarly, an _Eulerian circuit_ or _Eulerian cycle_ is an Eulerian trail that starts and ends on the same vertex. ... The term _Eulerian graph_ has two common meanings in graph theory. One meaning is a graph with an Eulerian circuit, and the other is a graph with every vertex of even degree. These definitions coincide for connected graphs. ... A graph that has an Eulerian trail but not an Eulerian circuit is called _semi-Eulerian_." Correspondingly, an _Eulerian path_ is defined as "a trail containing all edges" (see definition in [Bollobas] p. 16) in ~ df-eupth resp. ~ iseupth . ` ( EulerPaths `` G ) ` is the set of all Eulerian paths in graph ` G `, see ~ eupths . An _Eulerian circuit_ (called _Euler tour_ in the definition in [Diestel] p. 22) is "a circuit in a graph containing all the edges" (see definition in [Bollobas] p. 16), or, with other words, a circuit which is an Eulerian path. The function mapping a graph to the set of its Eulerian paths is defined as ` EulerPaths ` in ~ df-eupth , whereas there is no explicit definition for Eulerian circuits (yet): The statement "` <. F , P >. ` is an Eulerian circuit" is formally expressed by ` ( F ( EulerPaths `` G ) P /\ F ( Circuits `` G ) P ) `. Each Eulerian path can be made an Eulerian circuit by adding an edge which connects the endpoints of the Eulerian path (see ~ eupth2eucrct ). Vice versa, removing one edge from a graph with an Eulerian circuit results in a graph with an Eulerian path, see ~ eucrct2eupth . An Eulerian path does not have to be a path in the meaning of definition ~ df-pths , because it may traverse some vertices more than once. Therefore, "Eulerian trail" would be a more appropriate name. The main result of this section is (one direction of) _Euler's Theorem_: "A non-trivial connected graph has an Euler[[ian] circuit iff each vertex has even degree." (see part 1 of theorem 12 in [Bollobas] p. 16 and theorem 1.8.1 in [Diestel] p. 22) or, expressed with Eulerian paths: "A connected graph has an Euler[[ian] trail from a vertex x to a vertex y (not equal with x) iff x and y are the only vertices of odd degree." (see part 2 of theorem 12 in [Bollobas] p. 17). In ~ eulerpath , it is shown that a pseudograph with an Eulerian path has either zero or two vertices of odd degree, and ~ eulercrct shows that a pseudograph with an Eulerian circuit has only vertices of even degree.

blocks.content: Define the set of all Eulerian paths on an arbitrary graph. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: releupth
blocks.content: The set ` ( EulerPaths `` G ) ` of all Eulerian paths on ` G ` is a set of pairs by our definition of an Eulerian path, and so is a relation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

  |- wceq(cfv(ceupth, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(c1)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mptru(wceq(cfv(ceupth, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(c1))))))
  fvmptopab(s0, s1, hs0, ceupth, c0, ctrls, wtru, wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(c1)), wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)))))
  adantl(wtru, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wb(wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)))), wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(c1))))
  syl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wb(wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)))), wfo(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cdm(c1))), wceq(cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0))), cdm(c1)))
  dmeqd(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl6eqr(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(ciedg, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))

  foeq3(cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0))), cdm(c1), cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))
  a1i(wtru, wcel(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1))), universe))

  trliswlk(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))

}

thm eupths(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (EulerPaths ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚àß(s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom(c1)))}
  ‚ä£ c1 =(iEdg ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  mptru((EulerPaths ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚àß(s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom(c1)))})
  fvmptopab(s0, s1, hs0, ceupth, c0, ctrls, wtru, (s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom(c1)), (s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom((iEdg ` hs0))))
  adantl(wtru, hs0 = c0, ((s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom((iEdg ` hs0)))‚Üî(s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom(c1))))
  syl(hs0 = c0, ((s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom((iEdg ` hs0)))‚Üî(s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom(c1))), dom((iEdg ` hs0))= dom(c1))
  dmeqd((iEdg ` hs0), c1, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr((iEdg ` hs0), c1, (iEdg ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, ciedg)
  foeq3(dom((iEdg ` hs0)), dom(c1), s0, (0[..^](# ` s0)))
  a1i(wtru, { < s0, s1 > | s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 } ‚àà ùïå)
  ssexi({ < s0, s1 > | s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 }, { < s0, s1 > | s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 })
  wksv(s0, s1, c0)
  ssopab2i(s0, s1, s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1, s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1)
  trliswlk(s0, c0, s1)
  df-eupth(hs0, s0, s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.wtru.s(s0)
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs0.w((s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Ü† dom(c1)))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: iseupth
blocks.content: The property " ` <. F , P >. ` is an Eulerian path on the graph ` G ` ". An Eulerian path is defined as bijection ` F ` from the edges to a set ` 0 ... ( N - 1 ) ` and a function ` P : ( 0 ... N ) --> V ` into the vertices such that for each ` 0 <_ k < N ` , ` F ( k ) ` is an edge from ` P ( k ) ` to ` P ( k + 1 ) ` . (Since the edges are undirected and there are possibly many edges between any two given vertices, we need to list both the edges and the vertices of the path separately.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-May-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.) (Revised by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm iseupth(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wb(wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c3))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c1))
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs0, hs1, c0, ceupth, c1, c2, ctrls, wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c3)), wfo(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), cdm(c3)))
  eupths(hs0, hs1, c1, c3)
  foeq123d(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), cdm(c3), c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c3), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  adantr(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))
  oveq2d(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cfv(chash, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, chash)
  eqidd(cdm(c3), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  reltrls(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs0.w(wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c3)))
  diff.hs1.w(wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c3)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iseupth(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[(EulerPaths ` c1)]c2 ‚Üî(c0[(Trails ` c1)]c2 ‚àß(c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Ü† dom(c3))))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(iEdg ` c1)
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs0, hs1, c0, ceupth, c1, c2, ctrls, (c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Ü† dom(c3)), (hs0 :(0[..^](# ` hs0))‚Ü† dom(c3)))
  eupths(hs0, hs1, c1, c3)
  foeq123d(hs0, (0[..^](# ` hs0)), dom(c3), c0, (0[..^](# ` c0)), dom(c3), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  simpl(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2)
  adantr(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2, (0[..^](# ` hs0))=(0[..^](# ` c0)))
  oveq2d(nat0, cfzo, (# ` hs0), (# ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, chash)
  eqidd(dom(c3), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  reltrls(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Ü† dom(c3)))
  diff.hs1.w((c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Ü† dom(c3)))
}

blocks.name: eupthf1o
blocks.content: The ` F ` function in an Eulerian path is a bijection from a half-open range of nonnegative integers to the set of edges. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: eupthfi
blocks.content: Any graph with an Eulerian path is of finite size, i.e. with a finite number of edges. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: eupthseg
blocks.content: The ` N ` -th edge in an eulerian path is the edge having ` P ( N ) ` and ` P ( N + 1 ) ` as endpoints . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

  eupthi(c0, c1, c2, c4)

  rspccv(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), c3, wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, c3), cfv(c2, co(c3, caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, c3))))
  sseq12d(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cpr(cfv(c2, c3), cfv(c2, co(c3, caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, c3)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))

}

  |- wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wb(wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), w3a(wf1o(c1, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), cdm(c3)), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c1)), c4), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c0))

blocks.name: upgreupthi
blocks.content: Properties of an Eulerian path in a pseudograph. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: upgreupthseg
blocks.content: The ` N ` -th edge in an eulerian path is the edge from ` P ( N ) ` to ` P ( N + 1 ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: eupthcl
blocks.content: An Eulerian path has length ` # ( F ) ` , which is an integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: eupthistrl
blocks.content: An Eulerian path is a trail. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 24-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: eupthiswlk
blocks.content: An Eulerian path is a walk. (Contributed by AV, 6-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: eupthpf
blocks.content: The ` P ` function in an Eulerian path is a function from a finite sequence of nonnegative integers to the vertices. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: eupth0
blocks.content: There is an Eulerian path on an empty graph, i.e. a graph with at least one vertex, but without an edge. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 5-Mar-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

  syl5bb(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wf1o(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(cres(c5, cima(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8)))))), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wf1o(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c1)))))

  f1oeq3d(c0, (0[..^](# ` c0)), dom((iEdg ` c1)), dom((c5 |`(c6 "(0[..^]c8)))), w0)

blocks.name: eupthres
blocks.content: The restriction ` <. H , Q >. ` of an Eulerian path ` <. F , P >. ` to an initial segment of the path (of length ` N ` ) forms an Eulerian path on the subgraph ` S ` consisting of the edges in the initial segment. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-May-2015.) (Revised by AV, 6-Mar-2021.) Hypothesis revised using the prefix operation. (Revised by AV, 30-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm eupthres(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {

} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wf1o(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(cres(c5, cima(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8))))))

H , Q >. ` of the supergraph ` S ` obtained by adding the new edge to the graph ` G ` . (Contributed by AV, 11-Mar-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

thm eupth2eucrct(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11, wff w0) {

blocks.name: trlsegvdeg
blocks.content: Formerly part of proof of ~ eupth2lem3 : If a trail in a graph ` G ` induces a subgraph ` Z ` with the vertices ` V ` of ` G ` and the edges being the edges of the walk, and a subgraph ` X ` with the vertices ` V ` of ` G ` and the edges being the edges of the walk except the last one, and a subgraph ` Y ` with the vertices ` V ` of ` G ` and one edges being the last edge of the walk, then the vertex degree of any vertex ` U ` of ` G ` within ` Z ` is the sum of the vertex degree of ` U ` within ` X ` and the vertex degree of ` U ` within ` Y ` . Note that this theorem would not hold for arbitrary walks (if the last edge was identical with a previous edge, the degree of the vertices incident with this edge would not be increased because of this edge). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 20-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: eupth2lem3lem4
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ eupth2lem3 , formerly part of proof of ~ eupth2lem3 : If an edge (not a loop) is added to a trail, the degree of the end vertices of this edge remains odd if it was odd before (regarding the subgraphs induced by the involved trails). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 25-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: eupth2lem3lem6
blocks.content: Formerly part of proof of ~ eupth2lem3 : If an edge (not a loop) is added to a trail, the degree of vertices not being end vertices of this edge remains odd if it was odd before (regarding the subgraphs induced by the involved trails). Remark: This seems to be not valid for hyperedges joining more vertices than ` ( P `` 0 ) ` and ` ( P `` N ) ` : if there is a third vertex in the edge, and this vertex is already contained in the trail, then the degree of this vertex could be affected by this edge! (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 25-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: eupth2lemb
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ eupth2 (induction basis): There are no vertices of odd degree in an Eulerian path of length 0, having no edge and identical endpoints (the single vertex of the Eulerian path). Formerly part of proof for ~ eupth2 . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 26-Feb-2021.)

  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cvtx, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ciedg, c3))

blocks.name: eupth2lems
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ eupth2 (induction step): The only vertices of odd degree in a graph with an Eulerian path are the endpoints, and then only if the endpoints are distinct, if the Eulerian path shortened by one edge has this property. Formerly part of proof for ~ eupth2 . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 26-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: eupth2
blocks.content: The only vertices of odd degree in a graph with an Eulerian path are the endpoints, and then only if the endpoints are distinct. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 26-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm eupth2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(crab(s0, c0, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c1), cv(s0))))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c3))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c3))))))

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cupgr))
  -| wi(w0, wfun(c4))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c3, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqtr3d(crab(s0, c0, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c1), cv(s0))))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c3))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c3)))), crab(s0, c0, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, cop(c0, cres(c4, cima(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)))))), cv(s0))))), w0)

  notbid(w0, wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, cop(c0, cres(c4, cima(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)))))), cv(s0))), wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c1), cv(s0))))
  breq2d(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, cop(c0, cres(c4, cima(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)))))), cv(s0)), cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c1), cv(s0)), w0)

  eqid(cop(c0, cres(c4, cima(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3))))))
  mpcom(w0, wceq(crab(s0, c0, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, cop(c0, cres(c4, cima(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)))))), cv(s0))))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c3))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c3))))), wcel(cfv(chash, c3), cn0))

thm eulerpathpr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2)), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  eqeltrd(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2), cfv(chash, cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))), wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2)))

  eupth2(s0, c3, c0, c2, c1, cfv(ciedg, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wfun(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cupgr), wfun(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c0, cuhgr))
  upgruhgr(c0)
  uhgrfun(c0, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2))
  ifbothda(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2)), wcel(cfv(chash, cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))), cpr(nat0, nat2)), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wcel(cfv(chash, emptycls), cpr(nat0, nat2)), wcel(cfv(chash, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1)))), cpr(nat0, nat2)))
  eleq1d(cfv(chash, emptycls), cpr(nat0, nat2), cfv(chash, cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))), wceq(emptycls, cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))))
  fveq2(emptycls, cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1)))), chash)
  eleq1d(cfv(chash, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1)))), cpr(nat0, nat2), cfv(chash, cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))), wceq(cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))))
  fveq2(cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1)))), chash)

  fvex(c2, nat0)
  fvex(c2, cfv(chash, c1))
  hashprg(cfv(c2, nat0), universe, cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1)), universe)

  diff.cupgr.s(s0)

thm eulerpathpr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 })
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  eqeltrd((# ` { s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)}), { 0, 2 }, (# ` if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))})), (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2))
  fveq2d(chash, { s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)}, if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}), (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2))
  eupth2(s0, c3, c0, c2, c1, (iEdg ` c0), (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2))
  simpl(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2, Fun((iEdg ` c0)))
  syl(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, Fun((iEdg ` c0)), c0 ‚àà UHGraph)
  upgruhgr(c0)
  uhgrfun(c0, (iEdg ` c0))
  eqid((iEdg ` c0))
  simpr(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)
  ifbothda(emptycls, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}, (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2), (# ` if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}))‚àà { 0, 2 }, (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), (# ` ‚àÖ)‚àà { 0, 2 }, (# ` {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))})‚àà { 0, 2 })
  eleq1d((# ` ‚àÖ), { 0, 2 }, (# ` if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))})), ‚àÖ = if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}))
  fveq2(emptycls, if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}), chash)
  eleq1d((# ` {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}), { 0, 2 }, (# ` if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))})), {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))} = if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}))
  fveq2({(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}, if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}), chash)
  a1i(((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)‚àß(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1))), (# ` ‚àÖ)‚àà { 0, 2 })
  eqeltri((# ` ‚àÖ), { 0, 2 }, nat0)
  hash0()
  prid1(nat0, nat2)
  c0ex()
  syl6eqel((# ` {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}), { 0, 2 }, nat2, ((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)‚àß ¬¨(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1))))
  sylib(((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)‚àß ¬¨(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1))), (# ` {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))})= 2, (c2 ` 0)‚â†(c2 `(# ` c1)))
  neqned((c2 ` 0), (c2 `(# ` c1)), ((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)‚àß ¬¨(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1))))
  simpr((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2), ¬¨(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)))
  mp2an(((c2 ` 0)‚â†(c2 `(# ` c1))‚Üî(# ` {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))})= 2), (c2 ` 0)‚àà ùïå, (c2 `(# ` c1))‚àà ùïå)
  fvex(c2, nat0)
  fvex(c2, (# ` c1))
  hashprg((c2 ` 0), universe, (c2 `(# ` c1)), universe)
  prid2(nat2, nat0)
  2ex()
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ciedg, c0)

  diff.cupgr.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, c1, (EulerPaths ` c0), c2)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ceupth, c0)
  diff.ceupth.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: eulerpath
blocks.content: A pseudograph with an Eulerian path has either zero or two vertices of odd degree. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 26-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm eulerpath(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wne(cfv(ceupth, c0), emptycls)), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  impcom(wcel(c0, cupgr), wne(cfv(ceupth, c0), emptycls), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2)))
  sylbi(wne(cfv(ceupth, c0), emptycls), wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2))), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0)))))
  bitri(wne(cfv(ceupth, c0), emptycls), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0)))), wne(cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0)), emptycls))
  necon3bii(cfv(ceupth, c0), emptycls, cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0)), emptycls)
  ax-mp(wb(wceq(cfv(ceupth, c0), emptycls), wceq(cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0)), emptycls)), wrel(cfv(ceupth, c0)))
  releupth(c0)
  reldm0(cfv(ceupth, c0))
  n0(hs0, cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0)))
  exlimiv(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0))), wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2))))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0))), wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2))), wex(hs1, wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ceupth, c0), cv(hs1))))
  eldm(hs1, cv(hs0), cfv(ceupth, c0))
  vex(hs0)
  exlimiv(hs1, wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ceupth, c0), cv(hs1)), wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2))))
  expcom(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ceupth, c0), cv(hs1)), wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2)))
  eulerpathpr(s0, c0, cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cdm(cfv(ceupth, c0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2))))
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(ceupth, c0))
  diff.hs1.w(wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))), cpr(nat0, nat2))))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm eulerpath(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß(EulerPaths ` c0)‚â† ‚àÖ)‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 })
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  impcom(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, (EulerPaths ` c0)‚â† ‚àÖ, (# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 })
  sylbi((EulerPaths ` c0)‚â† ‚àÖ, (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 }), ‚àÉ(hs0, hs0 ‚àà dom((EulerPaths ` c0))))
  bitri((EulerPaths ` c0)‚â† ‚àÖ, ‚àÉ(hs0, hs0 ‚àà dom((EulerPaths ` c0))), dom((EulerPaths ` c0))‚â† ‚àÖ)
  necon3bii((EulerPaths ` c0), emptycls, dom((EulerPaths ` c0)), emptycls)
  ax-mp(((EulerPaths ` c0)= ‚àÖ ‚Üî dom((EulerPaths ` c0))= ‚àÖ), Rel((EulerPaths ` c0)))
  releupth(c0)
  reldm0((EulerPaths ` c0))
  n0(hs0, dom((EulerPaths ` c0)))
  exlimiv(hs0, hs0 ‚àà dom((EulerPaths ` c0)), (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 }))
  sylbi(hs0 ‚àà dom((EulerPaths ` c0)), (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 }), ‚àÉ(hs1, hs0[(EulerPaths ` c0)]hs1))
  eldm(hs1, hs0, (EulerPaths ` c0))
  vex(hs0)
  exlimiv(hs1, hs0[(EulerPaths ` c0)]hs1, (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 }))
  expcom(hs0[(EulerPaths ` c0)]hs1, c0 ‚àà UPGraph, (# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 })
  eulerpathpr(s0, c0, hs0, hs1, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(dom((EulerPaths ` c0)))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 }))
  diff.hs1.c(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c((EulerPaths ` c0))
  diff.hs1.w((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà c1 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)})‚àà { 0, 2 }))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: eulercrct
blocks.content: A pseudograph with an Eulerian circuit ` <. F , P >. ` (an "Eulerian pseudograph") has only vertices of even degree. (Contributed by AV, 12-Mar-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm eulercrct(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2)), wral(s0, c3, wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  mpd(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2)), wral(s0, c3, wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))), wceq(crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2), wceq(crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))))
  eupth2(s0, c3, c0, c2, c1, cfv(ciedg, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wfun(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cupgr), wfun(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c0, cuhgr))
  upgruhgr(c0)
  uhgrfun(c0, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2))
  syl6bi(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2)), wceq(crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))), wral(s0, c3, wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))), wceq(crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))), emptycls))
  eqeq2d(crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))), cif(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1)))), emptycls, w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2)))
  iftrued(emptycls, cpr(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))))
  simprd(wbr(c1, cfv(ccrcts, c0), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c1))), wbr(c1, cfv(ctrls, c0), c2))
  crctprop(c1, c0, c2)
  sylbi(wceq(crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))), emptycls), wral(s0, c3, wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))), wral(s0, c3, wn(wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))))
  rabeq0(s0, c3, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)))))
  ralimi(s0, c3, wn(wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))), wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))
  notnotr(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ciedg, c0)
  diff.ciedg.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cupgr)
  diff.cupgr.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, c1, cfv(ceupth, c0), c2)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ceupth, c0)
  diff.ceupth.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm eulercrct(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2 ‚àß c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2)‚Üí ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c3, 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  mpd((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2 ‚àß c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c3, 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)), { s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)} = if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}))
  3adant3(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2, c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2, { s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)} = if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}))
  eupth2(s0, c3, c0, c2, c1, (iEdg ` c0), (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2))
  simpl(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2, Fun((iEdg ` c0)))
  syl(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, Fun((iEdg ` c0)), c0 ‚àà UHGraph)
  upgruhgr(c0)
  uhgrfun(c0, (iEdg ` c0))
  eqid((iEdg ` c0))
  simpr(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)
  syl6bi((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2 ‚àß c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2), { s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)} = if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c3, 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)), { s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)} = ‚àÖ)
  eqeq2d({ s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)}, if((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), ‚àÖ, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}), emptycls, (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2 ‚àß c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2))
  iftrued(emptycls, {(c2 ` 0),(c2 `(# ` c1))}, (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2 ‚àß c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2), (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)))
  3ad2ant3(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2, c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2, (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)))
  simprd(c1[(Circuits ` c0)]c2, (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c1)), c1[(Trails ` c0)]c2)
  crctprop(c1, c0, c2)
  sylbi({ s0 ‚àà c3 | ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)} = ‚àÖ, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c3, 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c3, ¬¨ ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)))
  rabeq0(s0, c3, ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0))
  ralimi(s0, c3, ¬¨ ¬¨ 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0), 2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0))
  notnotr(2[||]((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ciedg, c0)
  diff.ciedg.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c0 ‚àà UPGraph, c1[(EulerPaths ` c0)]c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cupgr)
  diff.cupgr.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, c1, (EulerPaths ` c0), c2)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ceupth, c0)
  diff.ceupth.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: eucrctshift
blocks.content: Cyclically shifting the indices of an Eulerian circuit ` <. F , P >. ` results in an Eulerian circuit ` <. H , Q >. ` . (Contributed by AV, 15-Mar-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm eucrctshift(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(ccrcts, c1), c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c5, cfv(ccrcts, c1), c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(chash, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, co(nat0, cfzo, c7)))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c5, ccsh, c8))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, co(nat0, cfz, c7), cif(cfv(c6, co(cv(s0), caddc, c8)), cfv(c6, co(co(cv(s0), caddc, c8), cmin, c7)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, co(c7, cmin, c8)))))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c5, cfv(ceupth, c1), c6))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s0, c8)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  jca(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(ccrcts, c1), c2))
  sylibr(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4))))
  mpdan(w0, wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4))), wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2))
  crctcshtrl(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, c8, w0)
  jca(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2)), wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4)))
  simpr(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2))
  mpd(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2)), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4)), wf1o(c5, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c5)), cdm(c4)))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wf1o(c5, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c5)), cdm(c4)))
  syl(w0, wf1o(c5, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c5)), cdm(c4)), wbr(c5, cfv(ceupth, c1), c6))
  eupthf1o(c5, c1, c6, c4)
  impcom(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wi(wf1o(c5, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c5)), cdm(c4)), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4))))
  syl(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wi(w0, wi(wf1o(c5, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c5)), cdm(c4)), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4)))), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4)))
  3syl(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4)), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c4))))
  trliswlk(c0, c1, c2)
  wlkf(c0, c1, c2, c4)
  wrdf(c0, cdm(c4))
  com13(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4)), w0, wf1o(c5, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c5)), cdm(c4)), wfo(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c4)))

blocks.name: eucrct2eupth1
blocks.content: Removing one edge ` ( I `` ( F `` N ) ) ` from a nonempty graph ` G ` with an Eulerian circuit ` <. F , P >. ` results in a graph ` S ` with an Eulerian path ` <. H , Q >. ` . This is the special case of ~ eucrct2eupth (with ` J = ( N - 1 ) ` ) where the last segment/edge of the circuit is removed. (Contributed by AV, 11-Mar-2021.) Hypothesis revised using the prefix operation. (Revised by AV, 30-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm eucrct2eupth1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ciedg, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c6, cfv(ceupth, c4), c7))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c6, cfv(ccrcts, c4), c7))
  -| wceq(cfv(cvtx, c1), c3)
  -| wi(w0, wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c8, co(cfv(chash, c6), cmin, nat1)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c1), cres(c5, cima(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8)))))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c6, cpfx, c8))
  -| wceq(c2, cres(c7, co(nat0, cfz, c8)))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2)), wi(w0, wbr(c6, cfv(ccrcts, c4), c7)))
  eupthres(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, c8, w0)
  eqeltrd(c8, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c6)), co(cfv(chash, c6), cmin, nat1), w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(co(cfv(chash, c6), cmin, nat1), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c6))), wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn))
  mpd(w0, wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn), wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6)))
  3syl(w0, wi(wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6)), wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn)), wbr(c6, cfv(ceupth, c4), c7), wbr(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7))
  eupthiswlk(c6, c4, c7)
  syl(wbr(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7), wi(wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6)), wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn)), wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn0))
  wlkcl(c6, c4, c7)
  ex(wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn0), wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6)), wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn0), wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6))), wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn), wa(wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cz), wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6))))
  anim1i(wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cn0), wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(chash, c6)), wcel(cfv(chash, c6), cz))
  nn0z(cfv(chash, c6))
  elnnz(cfv(chash, c6))
  fzo0end(cfv(chash, c6))
}

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0[(EulerPaths ` c1)]c2)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Vtx ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(iEdg ` c4)

  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(iEdg ` c1)=(c5 |`(c6 "(0[..^]c8))))

  ‚ä£ c2 =(c7 |`(0[...]c8))

  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0[(EulerPaths ` c1)]c2), (w0 ‚Üí c6[(Circuits ` c4)]c7))

  eqeltrd(c8, (0[..^](# ` c6)), ((# ` c6)[-]1), w0)
  syl(w0, ((# ` c6)[-]1)‚àà(0[..^](# ` c6)), (# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï)
  mpd(w0, (# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï, 0[<](# ` c6))
  3syl(w0, (0[<](# ` c6)‚Üí(# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï), c6[(EulerPaths ` c4)]c7, c6[(Walks ` c4)]c7)
  eupthiswlk(c6, c4, c7)
  syl(c6[(Walks ` c4)]c7, (0[<](# ` c6)‚Üí(# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï), (# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  wlkcl(c6, c4, c7)
  ex((# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï0, 0[<](# ` c6), (# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï)
  sylibr(((# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß 0[<](# ` c6)), (# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï, ((# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß 0[<](# ` c6)))
  anim1i((# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñï0, 0[<](# ` c6), (# ` c6)‚àà ‚Ñ§)

blocks.name: eucrct2eupth
blocks.content: Removing one edge ` ( I `` ( F `` J ) ) ` from a graph ` G ` with an Eulerian circuit ` <. F , P >. ` results in a graph ` S ` with an Eulerian path ` <. H , Q >. ` . (Contributed by AV, 17-Mar-2021.) Hypothesis revised using the prefix operation. (Revised by AV, 30-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
